title: John Dean
summary: John Wesley Dean III (born October 14, 1938) is a former attorney who served as White House Counsel for United States President Richard Nixon from July 1970 until April 1973.  Dean is known for his role in the cover-up of the Watergate scandal and his subsequent testimony to Congress as a witness.  His guilty plea to a single felony in exchange for becoming a key witness for the prosecution ultimately resulted in a reduced sentence, which he served at Fort Holabird outside Baltimore, Maryland.  After his plea, he was disbarred as an attorney.
